definitions.definition: a person who helps or supports somebody, usually in their job

examples.text: My assistant will now demonstrate the machine in action.
I work part-time as a **classroom assistant** in my local primary school.
She was working as a special assistant to the president.
She had a clerical assistant to do her paperwork.
She is assistant to the Production Manager.
He worked as an assistant to the Sales Director.

definitions.definition: a person whose job is to serve customers in a shop

examples.text: an assistant in a department store
Maybe one of our assistants can help you make your choice?

definitions.definition: a student at university or college who spends time in a foreign country teaching his or her own language in a school

wordOrigin: late Middle English: from Old French, or from medieval Latin assistent- ‘taking one's stand beside’, from the verb assistere, from ad- ‘to, at’ + sistere ‘take one's stand’.
